intro: Heterostemma tanjorense, commonly known as the Tanjore starvine, is a flowering plant native to southern India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a slightly rough texture. Heterostemma tanjorense is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
